titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Robert Douglas Stuart Papers, 1944-1975
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Linda Bernard; machine-readable finding aid created by James Lake

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-03-21T17:01-0700

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, printed matter, and memorabilia, relating to American politics, American relations with Canada, and activities of the Canadian-American Committee.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert Douglas Stuart Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event:
Graduated from Princeton University
Started with Quaker Oats Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation cards and memorial resolutions, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Resolutions adopted by various organizations in memory of Robert D. Stuart,

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Autographs, by-laws, correspondence, lists, minutes, reports, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: Dulles, John Foster. Tribute by Richard M. Nixon, Printed copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, speeches, clippings, and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Clippings relating to Ambassador Stuart's appointed term in Canada
Business Advisory Council, U.S. Department of Commerce
Letters of introduction and recommendation written by Ambassador Stuart
U.S.-Canadian relations - Speeches by Douglas Copland, A. D. P. Heeney, L. B. Pearson, Donald R. Richberg, and others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, minutes, reports, resolutions, studies, speeches, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: With Alex McBain (United Funds Canada, Ltd.)
With R. M. Fowler (chairman, Private Planning Association of Canada and co-chairman, Canadian-American Committee)
Minutes of meetings and related correspondence,
Reprints of memoranda and studies spondored by the Canadian-American Committee and the the Private Planning Association of Canada
Speeches, including one by Robert D. Stuart,
North American common market for capital
Soviet Union - growth of economic power

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Citations, declarations, prayers, etchings, sketches, as well as oversize and mounted photographs.

did.unittitle: Citation to R. D. Stuart presented by the Foundation for American Agriculture,
Etching depicting the steps of St. Paul's Cathedral, London
"The President's Prayer" offered by Dwight D. Eisenhower before beginning his Inaugural Address,

1 print depicting a B-24 Liberator Bomber of USAF flying above palms of Makin Island; 1 print depicting Herbert Hoover (autographed to R. Douglas Stuart); 1 print depicting the Reunion Dinner of the Industrial Advisory Board, Washington D.C., March 7, 1934; and 1 print depicting a musk ox
2 prints depicting General Douglas MacArthur undated
